Actions.description: The available actions for this resource.
Actions.longDescription: This type shall contain the available actions for this resource.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

Oem.description: This property contains the available OEM specific actions for this resource.
Oem.longDescription: This property shall contain any additional OEM actions for this resource.

FeaturesRegistry.description: This is the schema definition for all Features Registries.  It represents the properties for the registries themselves.  The FeatureId is formed per the Redfish specification.  It consists of the RegistryPrefix concatenated with the version concatenated with the unique identifier for the feature registry entry.
FeaturesRegistry.longDescription: This resource shall be used to represent a Feature registry for a Redfish implementation.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

Actions.description: The available actions for this resource.
Actions.longDescription: The Actions property shall contain the available actions for this resource.

Features.description: The pattern property indicates that a free-form string is the unique identifier for the feature within the registry.
Features.longDescription: The pattern property shall represent the suffix to be used in the FeatureId and shall be unique within this message registry.

Language.description: This is the RFC 5646 compliant language code for the registry.
Language.longDescription: The value of this property shall be a string consisting of an RFC 5646 language code.

Oem.longDescription: This property shall contain the OEM extensions.  All values for properties that this object contains shall conform to the Redfish Specification-described requirements.

OwningEntity.description: This is the organization or company that publishes this registry.
OwningEntity.longDescription: The value of this property shall be a string that represents the publisher of this registry.

RegistryPrefix.description: This is the single word prefix used to form a Feature ID structure.
RegistryPrefix.longDescription: The value of this property shall be the prefix used in IDs which uniquely identifies all of the Features in this registry as belonging to this registry.

RegistryVersion.description: This is the feature registry version which is used in the middle portion of a Feature ID.
RegistryVersion.longDescription: The value of this property shall be the version of this message registry. The format of this string shall be of the format majorversion.minorversion.errata.

FeaturesRegistryProperty.description: The pattern type indicates that a free-form string is the unique identifier for the Feature within the registry.
FeaturesRegistryProperty.longDescription: The pattern type shall represent the suffix to be used in the Feature and shall be unique within this registry.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

OemActions.description: The available OEM specific actions for this resource.
OemActions.longDescription: This type shall contain any additional OEM actions for this resource.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

SupportedFeature.description: This type shall describe how a supported feature is defined within the registry.
SupportedFeature.longDescription: Each entity shall name a feature.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

CorrespondingProfileDefinition.description: The profile definition that defines the feature.
CorrespondingProfileDefinition.longDescription: If present, the value shall define a profile definition that contains the named profile declaration.

Description.longDescription: The value shall be a detailed description of the feature.

FeatureName.longDescription: The value shall be the unique name of the feature prefixed by the defining organization separated by a period (e.g. 'vendor.feature').

Version.longDescription: The value shall uniquely identify the version of the feature, using the major.minor.errata format.

title: #FeaturesRegistry.v1_0_1.FeaturesRegistry
